channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'We're going to kill them': Trump makes the war on drugs a reality
item.description: By its own account, the Trump administration has sunk 10 drug boats and slain 43 crew -- and has yet to offer a firm legal justification for it all.

item.title: Ex-Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger criticizes nationwide surge in gerrymandering: 'It saddens me'
item.description: Former California Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger expressed deep concern over the growing trend of partisan redistricting across the United States.

item.title: A Less Perfect Union
item.description: Abaraonye’s refusal to resign as president-elect of the Oxford Union has brought the Union to the brink of disaster.

item.title: Why William F. Buckley Jr.’s Gratitude Remains Relevant in 2025

item.title: Transportation Secretary Duffy warns of strain of government shutdown on air traffic controllers

item.title: 'Extrajudicial killings': Senators demand answers as Trump expands campaign against drug cartels
item.description: President Trump's military campaign against alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean is drawing bipartisan criticism in the Senate.

item.title: The Media’s Nazi-Symbol Hunters Take a Holiday

item.title: Unselected Admiration for Emma and Co.
item.description: Author Beth Brower’s heroine comes across as a real person, not a book character.

item.title: Why Trump Has Immunity for His Lawless, Lethal Attacks on the High Seas
item.description: Democratic lawfare, along with the president’s own renegade actions, helped get us to this point.

item.title: Is There Anyone On Comey’s Legal Team Who Wasn’t Getting Leaks From The FBI?
item.description: Comey retained another former leak recipient as an attorney, raising the question: Is there anyone on his defense team he wasn’t leaking to?

item.title: Jay Jones’ ‘Community Service’ Scandal Is Worse Than You Think
item.description: It looks like much of Jay Jones’ court-mandated community service hours were spent advancing his and Democrats' political interests.
